availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: A Kentucky farmer. Lived in Hancock County, Kentucky in 1860. Married to Mary "Polly" A. Gates Barr. Father of Charles R. Barr, John F. Barr, Catherine E. Barr, Thomas A. Barr, Lydia J. Barr, George E. Barr, and Annie M. Barr. Owned six enslaved persons in 1860. Lived in Hancock County from 1844 to 1863, when he moved his family to Daviess County, Kentucky. Member of the Methodist Church. Founding member of the Hancock Pond Draining Company in 1850.

bibl.p: History of Daviess County, Kentucky (Chicago: Inter-State Publishing Co., 1883), 638; "An Act to Incorporate the Hancock Pond Draining Company, and amend the charter of the Jefferson Pond Draining Company," Acts of the General Assembly of the Commonwealth of Kentucky: Passed at December Session, 1849 (Frankfort, Ky.: A. G. Hodges & Co.â€“ State Printers, 1849), 390-394; Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, p. 18; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, p. 2; "John A. Barr," (https://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=74007507&ref=acom) (accessed on April 11, 2017).
